AdditionalFields.Value: Molecular/Cellular Biology and Genetics,Prevention / Early Detection / Interception

Description: In recent years, advances in genetic sequencing technology, cancer epidemiology and targeted therapy have made germline genetic testing essential for cancer risk reduction and treatment. This session will cover the current state of clinical genetic testing, the distribution of pathogenic and uncertain variants and the management of results at the U.S. population level; discoveries from paired tumor and germline sequencing that inform cancer risk stratification and treatment selection; and genetic testing for high-penetrance syndromes such as Li Fraumeni and the challenge of clonal hematopoiesis in results interpretation.
SearchResultBody: ED18. Germline Genetic Testing in Cancer: Who, What and When?
Title: Germline Genetic Testing in Cancer: Who, What and When?
